# Contributing to Tributary

Thank you for your interest in contributing to Tributary! We welcome contributions from the community to help improve and grow the project.

## How to Contribute

### Reporting Issues

- Use the [Bug Report](https://github.com/tributary-so/tributary/issues/new?template=bug-report.md) template for bugs.
- Provide as much detail as possible, including steps to reproduce.

### Suggesting Features

- Use the [Feature Request](https://github.com/tributary-so/tributary/issues/new?template=feature-request.md) template.
- Describe the feature clearly and explain its benefits.

### Proposing Integrations

- Use the [Integration Request](https://github.com/tributary-so/tributary/issues/new?template=integration-request.md) template.
- Share your use case and how Tributary can help.

### Code Contributions

1. Fork the repository.
2. Create a feature branch from `main`.
3. Make your changes and ensure tests pass.
4. Submit a pull request with a clear description.

### Development Setup

- Install dependencies: `pnpm install`
- Run tests: `anchor test`
- Lint: `pnpm run lint`
- Build SDK: `cd sdk && pnpm run build`

## Guidelines

- Follow the existing code style and conventions.
- Write clear, concise commit messages.
- Ensure your changes don't break existing functionality.
- Be respectful and collaborative in discussions.

For more details, check our [documentation](https://docs.tributary.so).
